title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, February 15, 1866
summary: How responds to an order that appears to relate to his transportation supplies in the district. In response, he relates the shortage of transportation available to his agents, emphasizing the danger of Bureau agents traveling alone. He also describes the problems arising from the fact that his district spans two separate military departments.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Military Authority, American Civil War
